attributes.comment:
The proposed fee hike is as much as 200% in some cases. The significant
increase in filing fees for I-140 and I-485 would deter many of the self-sponsored
EB1-EA / EB2-NIW petitioners. In general many employers do not provide support
for EB1-EA and EB2-NIW petitions since they are not sponsored by the employer
and the benificiary has no obligation towards the employer.


EB1-EA and EB2-NIW beneficiaries are arguably the most beneficial to the United
States. Detering such people by steep increases in filing fees would adversely
impact the scientific and cultural advancement of the United States.

The final issue is the steep increase in fees for naturalization. Current permanent
residents are unrestricted in their ability to work in the United States and are very
likely to stay in the United States for the rest of their life. In such a scenario it
certainly makes sense from a security perspective that as many as possible
become citizens and pledge their allegiance to the United States. Detering people
from naturalization by increasing the fees for N-400 would be a major concern for
security of Unites States given the current situation.
